meanings.definition: Not created or made by human hands.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact was said to be increate, as it was believed to have been formed by natural forces.
meanings.sent2: The increate beauty of the untouched wilderness left the travelers in awe.
meanings.sent3: The increate design of the garden seemed almost magical, untouched by human hands.
meanings.sent4: Her increate talent for painting seemed to come from a place beyond this world.
meanings.sent5: The increate patterns in the clouds formed a mesmerizing display in the sky.

meanings.sent1: With regular watering, the plant will increate in size and eventually bloom.
meanings.sent2: The company hoped to increate its profits by expanding into new markets.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to increate in size as he pulled out more and more colorful scarves.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to increate in volume as the joke got funnier.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room began to increate as the concert drew closer.

meanings.definition: To make or become greater in size, amount, or degree.
meanings.sent1: The chef decided to increate the amount of spices in the recipe for a bolder flavor.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise can help increate your strength and endurance over time.
meanings.sent3: The students' enthusiasm seemed to increate with each passing day of the school trip.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed only continued to increate as she faced challenges.
meanings.sent5: The sense of community in the neighborhood began to increate as more families moved in.
